titleStmt.title: Register of Documents Prepared at the Grapheion
titleStmt.author: Kronion son of Apion

msContents.summary: Recto, col. II-XXII presents a financial register (anagraphe) of all the documents drawn up day by day in the record-office (grapheion) of Tebtynis during the 6th year of the Emperor Claudius; the writing fee (grammatikon) charged for the preparation of each document is indicated, and periodic summaries of the income and disbursements of the record office are given (See also the accounts of expenditures made by the grapheion official contained in Recto, col. I, and Verso, col. I-XII). - Recto, col. XX records the documents drawn up between July 26-31, 46 A.D.

msItemStruct.note: Due to the size of this papyrus roll, its content has been divided in the present database into several cards, one for each column.
Pub. status: Recto (written across the fibres); Verso (and Recto, col. I): grapheion accounts
Archive of Kronion son of Apion, nomographos of the grapheion of Tebtynis; see also note

condition.ab: Long roll broken at the right end, which was cut in seven pieces when housed into glass. - At the folds of the roll deep indentations have been worn from both edges toward the center of the sheet (the damage is most important in the right part of the roll). - The sheet bearing col. I of the recto and col. XI-XII of the Verso was attached to the rest after these columns had been written. - The papyrus was broken in the middle of col. XX, most of which is lost.

layout.ab: Source of description: Recto, col. XX

handDesc.p: medium-sized business hand (same as in P.Mich. II, 122). - Col. XVIII-XX of the Recto are written across the fibres of the sheet.

origin.origPlace: Tebtynis, Polemonos meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

provenance.p: Tebtynis, Polemonos meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
